website_summaries.verdict: The unlocked Motorola Moto G6 offers overall solid performance and surprisingly good camera capabilities for the price.

customer_reviews.title: Man, I love this phone when it works.
customer_reviews.text: This phone definitely has a lot going for it...except the one I got likes to randomly and continuously go into a boot loop....then it will just stop....be fine for a while...and continue to do so again.
customer_reviews.author: Joshua M.

customer_reviews.title: Not bad when you get used to it.
customer_reviews.text: Cell phone reception turns off almost every time I turn off the screen. Really stinks. Can't get calls unless I leave phone on. Edit: Now that I have had this phone longer I have gotten used to not having it in my pocket when I run my machine at work. The signal drops in that location but under most other places it works okay. Better than two Samsung phones I have owned. Not as good as a BLU phone I had before this one. I like it good enough now that I upped the one star ratings to 4 stars.
customer_reviews.author: bret4

customer_reviews.title: This phone sucks! Battery sucks. Missed calls
customer_reviews.text: Missed calls. Says no voicemail but I used my old phone and was able to get 5 voicemails. Important ones!!!! The battery is less than desireable. The data is slow and seems to be less capable than my droid Maxx 2. Sorry Motorola. I've been with you for years. I read what this phone was supposed to be that's why I got it and it sucks. I have to charge this halfway through my day.
customer_reviews.author: Jeff Handeguand

customer_reviews.title: Not a good phone
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this phone about a month ago new due to reviews and have been disappointed, The phone reboots randomly and the fixes do not work. The google assistant app always asking to be turned back on is very annoying. Had a Samsung galaxy 7 before it is a much better phone. I am currently searching for a different phone.
customer_reviews.author: mark

customer_reviews.title: Fails at being a phone.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this phone and got 70% less service! The LTE reception has been the worst I've ever dealt with. I spend more time looking at no signal, loading screens, or a bunch of LTE bars with a big X indicating the phone isn't bothering with a connection. WiFi connections that used to work all over my house just drop out. Apps run great...the phone UI responds very well....but it fails at it's most important job and that is dealing with wireless networks. And Moto/Lenovo insists it's my network. My carrier insists it's the phone. I don't like replacing phones after five months, but this thing is mostly useless when I need it.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Complete disappointment
customer_reviews.text: I had a Moto G4 for years and it was a beast of a phone, so when it finally kicked the bucket I decided to stick with the brand and try the G6. It has been a terrible disappointment. I've had it for only two months and it lags and glitches and spontaneously shuts down on me. The camera is nice, when it doesn't crash, but that's about all the good that I have to say about it. I expected better from a brand I once respected.
customer_reviews.author: L. St. Pierre

customer_reviews.title: Poor reception!
customer_reviews.text: Terrible phone. My biggest complaint since day one was the reception on this thing. Idk who at Lenovo worked on the antenna but this phone is unable to receive any signal strength at all. In fact, most of the time I'm lucky if I get 50% reception. This is the phone's defect as when I switch back to my old phone, the signal strength is so much better.
customer_reviews.author: Matt

customer_reviews.title: Not a happy camper.
customer_reviews.text: Just got the phone June 5, 2018. Now the phone will ring for incoming calls, but doesn't show them so I can't answer the phone. The return policy ended Aug. 5, 2018 & no warranty from the seller. This is a NEW unlocked phone and is useless if I can't answer incoming calls.
customer_reviews.author: Barb Bellin

customer_reviews.title: Some great things, some okay things
customer_reviews.text: I've come from a Galaxy S4 and S5. Things I don't like: The phone app is different from the Galaxy and adding contacts is different and not as obvious as the Galaxy S4. ___Inability to easily change the battery.___ While on a call, it is easy to mute or hang up if the phone is next to your ear. There are a few other quirks, but I can't think of them now. Things I like: The speed! All my apps transferred from my old phone without too much issue. The speaker is nice and loud. Memory Space! I can shake the phone to turn on the light.
customer_reviews.author: Jeff Gosnell

customer_reviews.title: I like Moto phones
customer_reviews.text: I've been with Moto phones from G4 through this G6. They operate intuitively for me. I am trying to convince my wife to switch to my previous one because her iPhone SE does not always announce calls and texts, and I can't help her fix it because the iPhone makes absolutely no sense to me: a retired computer and software professional and expert. Who was the iPhone designed for anyway?
customer_reviews.author: Steve BorsherTop Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: a good cell , a good price too
customer_reviews.text: great phone fast and sleek the only thing that I dont like is that it slides from most surfaces I have a samsung Galaxy Note 8 and it doesn't do that I'm making the comparison because both are glass front and back it fell down and crack the back so get a case Amazon has some and they are good it's a good alternative for people on a budget
customer_reviews.author: Hernan J. Aponte Malave

customer_reviews.title: Good phone with Bad antenna
customer_reviews.text: Bad attenna. The building I work in causes poor reception and this phone could not get any signal on Verizon. My old Droid turbo 2 could, so I had no choice but to return it.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel R. Downen

customer_reviews.title: Bugs and problems
customer_reviews.text: This phone is plagued with WiFi connection problems. Google search "why does my moto g6 phone constantly loses wifi connection" and you'll see how serious of a problem this is. There is also mysterious black screen issues when making calls. When it works, it takes decent pictures, has good performance with apps, and has a nice rich screen. However other issues involving mysteriously restarting without even touching it, failure to recognize Android movements for flashlight activation from time to time, and even faulty microphone behavior makes this phone an absolute nightmare to figure out. IF YOU CAN AFFORD A BETTER PHONE, SKIP THIS ONE.
customer_reviews.author: Martoune

customer_reviews.title: Great phone. Fixes take a while but they happen
customer_reviews.text: They fixed the Bluetooth after over a year and now I'm very happy. This phone is great.
customer_reviews.author: jared

customer_reviews.title: Bought this for my dad, was really good for like 4 months.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my dad to have because he wanted a cheaper phone that is still good. I have heard many good things on this one so thought we would give it a shot. It worked with verizon for us and was amazing for the fast 3-4 months, but now it is starting to lag and be glitchy. I am not sure if this is something a software update could fix, or if it is just the hardware wearing down.
customer_reviews.author: matar Emanuel

customer_reviews.title: Good value
customer_reviews.text: This is a good option if you're looking for an unlocked mobile phone at a great price. We bought two of these phones to take to Japan and the Japanese SIM cards worked with no problems. There's a nice amount of memory and the screen is us nice and large. It's also slim and easy to hold. The only negative I would give it is the battery life. It's a battery hog and I have to charge it frequently. If the battery charge life was better, I would have given it 5 stars.
customer_reviews.author: 5HappyCampers

customer_reviews.title: Poor Reception
customer_reviews.text: Poor reception on AT&T towers. No problems with my old phone. I'm on Straight Talk so thought I would try switching it to Verizon (CDMA) since others here seem to have better luck with that. I dealt with two separate people at Straight Talk and both told me this phone is not capable of using Verizon CDMA towers, even though the item description clearly states it will run on CDMA. Very frustrating. Turns out you can buy this phone for $180 at Walmart and it will run on CDMA.
customer_reviews.author: John

customer_reviews.title: lot of bad reviews... not my experience
customer_reviews.text: Fast delivery, got it same day . I like the resolution, makes it feel like a bigger phone when it's really not. Screen quality is very nice. I especially liked that the screen area is edge to edge. Battery seems about like any other phone. Use it all day, of course it will die on you pretty quickly. Its fast and has no trouble multitasking. This is my first Motorola, and I'm pretty impressed by all the features. Camera does take a minute to capture, but as long as you keep the phone steady, the quality is great. Will update if there are any issues. Hope this helps!
customer_reviews.author: flitterflutter

customer_reviews.title: Absolute garbage phone
customer_reviews.text: The worst phone I've ever owned. It might have been three stars until the android 9.0 update. The phone is borderline useless now - lags when you try to do anything. ANYTHING. Want to send a text? Could take a full minute while it freezes up for forty seconds. Want to browse a webpage? Freezes up. Want to open the camera to catch a special moment? Lol, the phone says to you, as you punch at the screen in frustration and your kid stops doing something cute. Never, ever, ever buy this phone.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel A. Zatkovich

customer_reviews.title: You get what you pay for
customer_reviews.text: I wanted to like this phone. It is full featured, at an affordable price. The first one I had was returned because of call quality. The second is better in this respect but has other problems. From the beginning it hasn't gotten as good reception as other phones I've owned (Samsung Galexy, Google Pixel, Apple iPhones). It is slow to respond to user interaction. But recently it has developed two quirks that will make me replace it after only 4 months... It will not stay connected to blue tooth devices, and it keeps putting itself on Do Not Disturb. I am not happy with this phone.
customer_reviews.author: MrFishk

customer_reviews.title: Camera glass lense came cracked - otherwise good phone.
customer_reviews.text: I thought it was part of the design, but I recently found that the glass part that covers the camera lenses is cracked horizontally. It came this way, but I really enjoy the phone otherwise. It's already after a month so I doubt Amazon will do anything about the broken glass... Pictures have a "mirrored" affect because of it. Either or, the phone is great for the price. Even with the preinstalled apps, they're not invasive like the moto g4 was. I suggest getting a cover for this phone, since the back of it is REALLY slippery, and it'll just slide off any surface if there's a little bit of a tilt.
customer_reviews.author: Myrandah

customer_reviews.title: Touch Screen Stopped Working After 20 Days
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this phone back in September 23rd and for about three weeks the phone worked. However, one afternoon the touchscreen on the phone stopped working completely. This issue happened on October 13th. I gave it a few hours before trying again. Nothing; no response from the screen or the fingerprint scanner. So I wait a few more days to test again. Right now, the only thing the phone can do is manually take screen shots, turn up or down the volume and do hard/soft resets. Both the touchscreen and the fingerprint scanner are non-responsive. Extremely disappointed in the build quality. 20 days of regular use of the phone and it stops working. Will be returning this phone.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew Ngo

customer_reviews.title: Unbelievable phone for the price - except the ONE speaker
customer_reviews.text: This phone is amazing for the price point. Fingerprint security, portrait mode photos, and the latest software. I particularly like the Moto gestures. I would give this a 4.8 if I could because my one complaint is that it has one speaker. It's a good one, but just one. With face recognition and all the other security features, I didn't need the finger print scanner after all, so I shouldn't have to give up my bottom/left speaker. But I only notice it when watching videos in landscape mode. Otherwise it's a great phone at an unbeatable price!
customer_reviews.author: A. J. Vance

customer_reviews.title: Second Times A Charm
customer_reviews.text: Purchased a G6 from a different vendor and was initially very pleased. Unfortunately, this G6 suddenly "died" and would not charge or start up. Fortunately, the vendor promptly provided a full refund as they had no G6's in stock. Purchased my most recent G6 from Amazon. So far this unit has performed flawlessly, which means no startup or charging issues. Initially, I was reluctant to purchase the Prime Exclusive G6, but there has been nothing intrusive about the Prime items loaded on the phone. Based on my experience to date I would recommend the G6, Prime or non-Prime.
customer_reviews.author: Robert

customer_reviews.title: Takes good pictures of my cat
customer_reviews.text: This phone is excellent. Takes good photos of my cat. This wouldn't be interesting otherwise, except for the fact that my cat is very black and my previous phones have had trouble with taking pictures of her. Good selfies, if I was into that kind of thing. Had it for several months now and it does all of the things that I want it to do, and I honestly think that you could not find a better phone for the price. Streams movies well, games are okay, pictures are good, and the reception is also very good if you actually care about it's abilities as a phone. A+
customer_reviews.author: Emily

customer_reviews.title: It was good while it lasted.
customer_reviews.text: When I bought it, it worked really well. After about 6 months of use, it stopped charging. I found on the internet that this is actually a very common thing. I went through ALL of the suggestions and of course, none of them worked. The recommended fix is to send the phone in to be repaired. Yeah, not going to do that and also not going to buy another Motorola! They were a decent company before Google bought them and stripped them from some secrets and sold them to lenovo. now, it's just a crap phone.
customer_reviews.author: KerryWhite

customer_reviews.title: Too many issues
customer_reviews.text: First Issue: Phone rings........there was no option to see who was calling or to answer the call. I had to wait until call displayed on missed miss call log in order to call the person back. Second Issue: The sound went out completely. My only method now is to send text. Reading different forums. I tried reset factory settings.... and hard reset deleting everything.. Resolution- Incoming calls would display; however I can only with ear buds. 3rd Issue and Final....My phone will not turn ON NOW! I PURCHASED THIS PHONE IN OCT!!!!!!!!! Amazon I NEED ANOTHER PHONE ASAP!
customer_reviews.author: darlene mosley

customer_reviews.title: Moto because of no Security and Software updates are losing sales
customer_reviews.text: The problem Moto has is infrequent, late, or no security and software updates. Customers want Android 9 (Pie). You can discount the phone from $239 and $249 to $199 but it does not fix the problem. Every Nokia phone is Android One with timely security and software updates. The Nokia 6.1 is comparable to the Moto G6 and is $179. As Moto (Lenovo) customers we should encourage the company to make Android 9 a high priority item and release it as soon as possible
customer_reviews.author: Paul G

customer_reviews.title: Great priced phone that can do it all
customer_reviews.text: I am reviewing this phone because I see it has a moderately low ratings and I am not sure why. I love it so much I ended up buying one for my husband and my kids both g6 plays so the whole family has this series of phones. We use it on the simple mobile network. It does everything I want it to do, videos, gaming (things like game of sultans and garden scapes) without any issue. Charges super fast. Battery life is good. I really don't have any complaints. At the price it will do everything and more. No reason for a high priced phone or one you have to pay on installment with a cell carrier.
customer_reviews.author: JessicaS

customer_reviews.title: Expensive doesn't always mean better
customer_reviews.text: If you are looking for a smartphone that can compete with an iPhone or Galaxy for a fraction of the cost I would recommend this phone. Why buy used or refurbished when you can get this one for brand new for the same cost or less. I haven't found any negatives yet with this phone and i have had it for 4 months now. I do a lot of texting, emailing, calling, video streaming and pictures. I also use the mobile hotspot daily without issues.
customer_reviews.author: C. Summers

customer_reviews.title: Sooo disappointed...Went from one of my favorite phones to a dud
customer_reviews.text: LOVED this phone bought in Sept. Now 4 months later, screen doesn't stop flickering every few seconds rendering it un-usable. I've done re-sets, re-booted and nothing. It first started acting up by not charging while plugged in wall, only laptop. Now it charges in wall but can't get rid of flickering issue. Paid about $150 for a phone I could only use for 4 months. Guess I'll stick to BLU from now on...no more Motorola for me. Stopped charging alltogether...sent back to Motorola. They won't fix it. Sent it back. Horrible.
customer_reviews.author: rose

customer_reviews.title: Best of the "value" phones
customer_reviews.text: Great value for my oldest son's first phone. This phone is cheap but powerful enough to let him do real work for his classes including messaging, research, writing, and even basic presentation layout. It's about as close to a stock Android experience as you're going to see outside of Google and even made me jealous enough to recently upgrade my own phone from an older Samsung to the new Google Pixel 3, but I kinda wish it had aome of the Moto G6 motion actions to open the LED flashlight, etc. Overall a great purchase and should last at least 3-4 years (assuming it doesn't get destroyed in the meantime.)
customer_reviews.author: Noumenon

customer_reviews.title: Crap
customer_reviews.text: I was told this was a response to a more expensive phone at a reasonable price. Don't be fooled. It is hands down the worst, most glitchy excuse for a phone I have seen. I have seen cheaper phones that were more durable, for less money. Caveat Emptor.
customer_reviews.author: sondra ernst

customer_reviews.title: IMO - best Moto thus far
customer_reviews.text: Purchased mine June 2018. I love it. I did break the back glass case. It was my fault, as I rolled over on it while installing floor molding. The part to fix was reasonable and straight forward to replace. Other than that - phone works great. FWIW - I have owned G2, G3, G4, and I skipped G5. The G6 size is perfect for my aging eyes and access speed is perfect. Best Moto thus far in my opinion! The G7 screen is going to be too large for me. I will get one for my wife, as she is due an upgrade from her current phone.
customer_reviews.author: claymore

customer_reviews.title: Hot Garbage
customer_reviews.text: This seems like it should be a great value phone. It is not. It freezes up for 5-20 seconds frequently doing basic apps (like messaging). Forget trying to doing anything demanding on it, the phone will just hang for a while and then give up. I'm not talking about games or anything, apps like Disney's park app completely overwhelm it.
customer_reviews.author: Bard Medicine

customer_reviews.title: Poor signal, unreliable.
customer_reviews.text: This is not our first time buying a Moto series phone off Amazon. My husband has been using this phone for less than 4 months, and it's the worst phone he's had yet. The signal is terrible for some reason. There are times when his phone has no signal at all, when my Moto series phone, placed right next to his, has a good signal. The phone itself is a bit glitchy also, random things it would be hard to describe here. Pick a different model, we've had good luck with all the other Moto phones in the past.
customer_reviews.author: Mad-a-gascar

customer_reviews.title: Great phone, great price
customer_reviews.text: Works like a charm. I bought this for my daughter after doing some research. I loved the old Google Nexus 5 phones, so I was trying to find something similar. This got the bill and has a few nifty features like giving it a double shake to turn the flashlight on and off, etc. I currently have an LG G6, which has been giving me problems, so I'm seriously considering buying another one of these for myself until the new 5G phones come out in a reasonable price range
customer_reviews.author: Elizabeth O'Neal

customer_reviews.title: Good on a budget
customer_reviews.text: I got this phone for my mother as she wanted a smartphone but doesn't want to pay a high price. After months of research we settled on this. The prime version was only $150 when the T-Mobile version was almost $400. It is fairly snappy with 3gb of ram and has a decent amount of storage. The camera is perfect for her but nowhere near the standard of a Galaxy s9 or new model Iphone. She loves that she can get all her apps and play her casino games. Its fairly large, the screen I believe is at least 6in, but I definitely recommend getting a case. All in all its a great budget smartphone.
customer_reviews.author: A.Marte

customer_reviews.title: Love it! Came from flagships
customer_reviews.text: Coming from a long line of samsung and lg flagships I was a little nervous buying a $240 phone. But my S7 was just getting so slow and I didn't want to fork up nearly a grand or pay att a month fee. So I went for it and bought this phone. Now I've had it for a few months and absolutely love it. Honestly can't notice a performance difference between this and my old s7. One thing is camera is pretty sub par but that doesn't bother me. So for 240 it's a no brainer even if it does poop out in a couple years, because so do the $1000 flagships.
customer_reviews.author: Jacob W.

customer_reviews.title: Not worth the purchase it stops working constantly
customer_reviews.text: Leaving this review on behalf of ny mother. This phone is horrible bought it as a gift for her and it had to be sent back upon set up as you could not hear her on the phone now 6 months later the replacement phone powered off and will not come back on. When plugged into charge no power or charge comes on. Her amazon stuff hadnt always worked which she was excited for and pushed her to want this phone. Would not waste my time or money on this phone. Forcing her to stop using motorolla as she takes good care with little use to her devices and they never work right or last
customer_reviews.author: CY

customer_reviews.title: Quality product at a value price
customer_reviews.text: I killed my Nexus 5 (which I REALLY liked) so looked for an updated replacement. The G6 is not exactly new to market but appeared to be a good fit for me so I took a chance. I've been very pleased with the phone so far - battery life is excellent (admittedly I am not a heavy user), the camera is terrific, reception has been great and the OS is familiar; what's not to like?
customer_reviews.author: tlbrad774

customer_reviews.title: decent phone
customer_reviews.text: all in all i'm pleased. The software can be a little glitchy. I was being notified that Alexa had stopped 8-20 times a day. I disabled Alexa and most problems stopped. Still get an occasional glitch. like when you tap on things on the notifications on the drop down and the lock screen. Sometimes, it will open the app, sometimes it won't. For the same app too. one time it will open the associated app, another it won't. don't know if that is Moto or Amazon's fault. its just irritating. phone still works.
customer_reviews.author: m s

customer_reviews.title: Cheaply made
customer_reviews.text: Speakers on 2 different phone will suddenly stop and start, known flaw to phone that hasn't been fixed. The screen are also garbage, if it drops, even with tempered glass, the screen is done. Had 2, both were junk and ended up to be more expensive then a samsung
customer_reviews.author: Mike C

customer_reviews.title: No one can hear me with speaker on. I can't hear anyone without speaker on
customer_reviews.text: Speaker and microphone permissions are turned on and volumes are up. I'm not blocking mic with my hand. I've tried holding the phone at various distances and angles but no one can hear me when speaker is on, and without speaker on it's so quiet I can't hear anyone even though volumes are turned up. Also don't like that certain defaults keep resetting themselves .
customer_reviews.author: DK

customer_reviews.title: Excellent phone for the price!
customer_reviews.text: Pros: *Crisp and clear display, love the aspect ratio *Great reception *T-Mobile WiFi calling works perfectly *WiFi works great, no dropped connections yet *Really like the haptic response / vibration motor; much better than previous Moto Gs imo *Glass back makes the phone feel more premium than it is Cons: *Battery life is meh; it still lasts all day, but after updating to Pie it's drains noticeably faster *There's a slight delay when unlocking with the fingerprint reader
customer_reviews.author: SD

customer_reviews.title: Run for your life!!!
customer_reviews.text: I'm sure now that I have a used phone. I did not start using it immediately cuz my old g5 was working ok still. The date to return passed so I'm screwed. The accelerater or gyroscope is off horribly. Holding it laterally, it has to be all the way up or it will stay horizontal. And using GPS. The arrow will keep pointing left of where I am actually going and swing horribly. I have to calibrate the phone at least 2 times a day. I pissed cuz my g5 was great until the niece chucked it. Disappointing..
customer_reviews.author: Dierdre

customer_reviews.title: No sound!
customer_reviews.text: This phone worked great for just over 30 days the the sound quit. All sounds, ringer hearing phone calls, everything! I cannot recommend this phone to anyone. I did talk to Motorola customer service, but they just said send it in and we will take a look at it! now I am without a phone for a week or more.
customer_reviews.author: KJG

customer_reviews.title: Glass backs are a real bad idea
customer_reviews.text: This is my first Android. I generally like it but there’s two major problems with it. First, the glass back is a poor, though popular, design choice. It slides off of things really easily, and then it is very likely to break when it does. My back shattered within a couple weeks of having it. Get a case and never take it out unless you like the look of broken glass. Second, the speaker has gone bad. When I play from the speaker it is much quieter and sounds blown out. I could probably get it replaced under warranty but I haven’t bothered yet because I use the phone and don’t want to send it away.
customer_reviews.author: Joshua

customer_reviews.title: Would be nicer if it wasn’t a returned phone
customer_reviews.text: Bought as an international travel phone and for the price, it’s a good size, nice screen, not exactly a ton of storage space, so I added a memory card. Still doesn’t have the OS update available, but according to the Moto website it should happen soon. My only gripe is I paid for a new phone but definitely received something someone returned. Covered in fingerprints and the inside of the box was dusty. Unlike some other reviewers at least who ever returned this, the phone was actually wiped. I’m not sure if I got a refurb instead, but I paid for a new phone.
customer_reviews.author: marina

customer_reviews.title: Best Deal Ever!!!
customer_reviews.text: Ok, I could just kick myself for spending hundreds of dollars for a cell phone. The last one (Samsung 8) was over $400.00. This phone does EVERYTHING the Samsung did at a fraction of the price. I'm so happy with this purchase! It came loaded with Amazon features that I simply love, it is a Motorola G6 and I paid less than $150.00 AWESOME!!!
customer_reviews.author: MaryWawa

customer_reviews.title: A
customer_reviews.text: The microphone on the phone I received didn't work right. Everyone I called couldn't hear me. Once I plugged in headphones everything worked fine tho. This is the 3rd piece of s*** phone I've bought from Amazon every single one of them was around $200-$300 and not a single one has worked like it was supposed to, each was either bricked within a month or other issues. I will not be purchasing ANY type of phone off Amazon at any time in the future.
customer_reviews.author: Shadb

customer_reviews.title: Great mid-range specs!!
customer_reviews.text: Great mid-range specs pretty good camera I am on T-Mobile and I get great service no dropped calls and yes Wi-Fi calling does work. this is a glass phone so you might want to pick up a case and a screen protector to keep it looking new
customer_reviews.author: dan

customer_reviews.title: Great so far fast no lag screen is bright and ...
customer_reviews.text: Great so far fast no lag screen is bright and vivid. Has adoptable storage options available via micro sd card (Use SD Card as internal storage). Nice build quality solid phone for 235.
customer_reviews.author: King JLR

customer_reviews.title: Not good. Not secure. Pop ups turn screen on
customer_reviews.text: This phone would be great if I got the regular one, not the Amazon version to save a few bucks. The screen doesn't stay off after locking it because commercials keep popping up when phone is supposed to be off. I set up fingerprint lock, my bf got on my phone in less than 2 minutes. It is terrible and never can read my fingers!!
customer_reviews.author: Jessica Kimball

customer_reviews.title: Great bargain for the money spent.
customer_reviews.text: For the price you pay for this smart phone, it is well worth the money. You don't get best battery life or sound quality on calls, but everything else has been perfect for me how I use my phone. It came preloaded with Amazon apps which save me time/effort downloading all that I use. Fortunately, I live in a metro area so taking it to my carrier and having them transfer the service was a breeze and only took 30 minutes.
customer_reviews.author: Remus1913

customer_reviews.title: Great phone, great price!
customer_reviews.text: After being a complete Samsung Galaxy snob since the S3, I decided to finally change up my phone and try the Moto G6. I am not at all regretting that decision! This phone is great. It has more than enough memory, more features than anyone could ever use, and the screen resolution makes everything look more vibrant and beautiful. Comes with a great fast charger, which fully charges the device within an hour from 0%. Also comes with key to open port for micro SD. The only thing you really need to know is that the battery is not removable without disassembly of phone.
customer_reviews.author: Sarah

customer_reviews.title: A normal well working phone
customer_reviews.text: I think the Moto phone works well, and holds a charge for a good amount of time. It does not have any special bells and whistles, but it does what any basic android phone does. I have been happy with mine, and did get it at a decent price.
customer_reviews.author: justgazin

customer_reviews.title: quality sucks
customer_reviews.text: It does not get 4G signal in some areas making it completely useless. I know this is not a network problem and a phone problem because, Iphone 5 with same network at the same place gets a good signal. This is ridiculous!
customer_reviews.author: Mamta K

customer_reviews.title: Reboot Loop and Faulty Phone
customer_reviews.text: Got the Amazon Prime Moto G6 and it's not even 1 day old and stuck on a weird and constant rebooting loop. "Hello Moto" is no longer something I look forward to hearing. Sad that the phone isn't working. Will set up return and refund soon. Very disappointing.
customer_reviews.author: Kenny

customer_reviews.title: It's just a pain in the.....
customer_reviews.text: Dumbest decision I made was to buy this phone. Can't schedule a message like I could with my Samsung, can't delete multiple text messages, health app doesn't work well, other apps I can't load, and just general functions like swiping, notifications, etc., are just a pain in the butt. Transfer of old stuff didn't take well. I just hate this phone. I gotta get back to Samsung or something better than this one.
customer_reviews.author: A Miller

customer_reviews.title: Great Phone but has bugs
customer_reviews.text: I love this phone, but it has a serious bug that Mot has not fixed. When you try to view the storage, the action will never complete. I tried to clear the cache but could never get to that part of the menu. I researched and found other users are having the same issue. Very frustrating.
customer_reviews.author: Reader

customer_reviews.title: Shattered back, errors, low speaker, do not buy
customer_reviews.text: I have had this phone since July of 2018. Within a couple of months, the whole back shattered. The software keeps saying Google error every time a text or phone call comes in or is made. The notifications can not be altered in settings to stop it. Updates do not fix it. The speaker faded fast. You have to put people on speaker phone to hear them at a regular volume. The camera works great... Overall, do not buy this phone. Invest a little more money to get a better quality phone.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Liked it until the camera quit focusing on distance shots
customer_reviews.text: I bought this phone six months ago, and I liked it fine until the focus quit working on my distance shots, like mountain views. I've tried all the troubleshooting ideas I could find, nothing works. Now I am REALLY UNHAPPY with this phone! IT WAS BRAND NEW BUT ONLY HAD A ONE-MONTH GUARANTEE! What am I going to do, throw it out and buy a new one? I can't afford to do that!!
customer_reviews.author: Vanstaats

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed
customer_reviews.text: Loved the phone for about 3 months but then the phone started to act as if there was always headphones in it, this makes it impossible to make calls or listen to videos or music. I thought I might be the only one experiencing this but no, it is a very Common problem. Do not buy, not worth the headache Update: dropped from 2 stars to 1 because the mic also went out on the phone. and this isn't a rare occurrence, many people are having issues with this.
customer_reviews.author: Robert

customer_reviews.title: Constant ads and spam text that you cant opt out.
customer_reviews.text: This phone works well enough. The biggest complaint I have are all the millions of advertisement, spam texts, and other crap that comes through this phone. There are ads after every call and I reciece about 3 spam texts per day. Whenever I have searched something on my phone I get text messages and spam calls related to that search anfew days later. I havent been able.to block the constant text messages from random sources and advertisers. I have never gotten so much junk mail on a phone ever and no one else in my house gets them on their phone as frequently.
customer_reviews.author: R. Santos

customer_reviews.title: The best phones I had
customer_reviews.text: This is the third Amazon Prime I've had, previously I had the Moto G4, the Moto G5+ and not the Moto G6. The phones are great they've never failed me, even when I've failed them (pool accident, but the G5 was up and running a few hours later). I hope Amazon keeps working with Motorola to offer great phones at a great price.
customer_reviews.author: Randall Davila

customer_reviews.title: Cheaply made
customer_reviews.text: I was really excited about getting the new Motorola G6. I had it for a short time and it fell like my other phones had many many times and the screen shattered. Not only did it shatter but the phone won't work now. I read there is no way to repair except for the Motorola company was charges and most as much as they do for the phone to repair it. I wasted $240 for a huge disappointment!!
customer_reviews.author: Cherie Lyons

customer_reviews.title: Good phone with good features for its price
customer_reviews.text: Perfect spot between price and usability. One small problem, during commute there are parts where the connection drops completely for a few seconds and reconnects 15-20 seconds later. It might not be noticeable to most. Beyond that there are no problems or issues with any of the phone's functions
customer_reviews.author: Fidel G.

customer_reviews.title: Not a good experience
customer_reviews.text: I've had the phone for 2 months now. The 3.5mm headphone jack has never worked and yesterday the phone decided to no longer connect to Verizon's network. I tried resetting the phone to factory and replace the SIM but it didn't work. The only solution is to send the phone back for a new one. Apparently this isn't common, but I'm definitely not the only one too.
customer_reviews.author: DianaBeblo

customer_reviews.title: Great phone, awkward screenshots
customer_reviews.text: I love everything about this phone except... The volume and power buttons are on the same side. To capture a screenshot, you have to hold the down volume and power button at the same time. It typically turns the volume down or prompts Turn off/Restart. Awkward and difficult for small, arthritic hands.
customer_reviews.author: I C Arky

customer_reviews.title: Nice phone, works good too
customer_reviews.text: Nice phone, works good too... BUT - POOR audio quality when talking on the phone. One almost needs to be in a silent room when speaking to someone on the phone. Motorola needs to do a recall and fix this issue. Otherwise the phone is good, but I would not recommend it, unless they fix this issue.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: A very good phone
customer_reviews.text: The Moto G6 is a very good phone. It comes in several versions. The charger cables are not interchangeable. I have 2 Moto G6 phones. The phones will work on both cell towers or internet. The screen quality is very sharp. The battery life is very good. I like the fingerprint reader because no one else can use the phone with out me there.
customer_reviews.author: John H. Parton

customer_reviews.title: Great phone for the price.
customer_reviews.text: Is it the Iphone X, no, but it does everything I need it to and more. If you are looking to waste your life playing games on your phone, I'm not sure this is the perfect one. I have one game, and it works fine though. It runs all of my work apps flawlessly, and it has enough memory to get the job done. The camera is pretty good, and I don't have any issues with things lagging. I'd buy it again.
customer_reviews.author: Josh

customer_reviews.title: Excellent product above than the price
customer_reviews.text: Amazing product for the price. One of best Motorola proucts I already have Moto g7 is too a awesome product . Moto g6 Display have 426 ppi better display than Moto g7 . If you check any new product of 2020. None of them even reach 400ppi. The mono speaker sound so good. Slim design make a excellent portable product. Pictures are Ok. I prefer this than a product with 48 megapixels producing mediocre pictures. Price is excellent
customer_reviews.author: miguel

customer_reviews.title: After purchasing my previous 3 phones as Motorola flagships Ive never had so many issues DO NOT BUY
customer_reviews.text: I have been troubleshooting this phone with software issues since I bought it. Just recently, not even owning the phone for a year, with zero physical damage on the phone, the microphone stopped working. Moto support is awful, they are giving me the run around, they want me to pay to have the phone repaired full almost the full price I paid for it. I've never felt more ripped off in my life. They've lost a loyal customer forever... I can not emphasize this enough. DO NOT BUY
customer_reviews.author: Josh Averie

customer_reviews.title: Will only last for maybe 4 months save your money!
customer_reviews.text: Everything was great until it stopped charging, everytime I plug it up it doesn't recognize that the charger is in and it has died and now I can't cut it back on, looking online for a way to fix it revealed that alot of people have this issue with these phones after awhile. Wish I would have known before buying!
customer_reviews.author: Ashley L

customer_reviews.title: Worst Phone
customer_reviews.text: This phone has been terrible. Many of my text messages with pictures do not get sent and I have to resend them in a new message. My google assistant has stopped working, and my google maps quit working as well. Please do not buy this phone, it is way too much money for the quality of the phone.
customer_reviews.author: Josh

customer_reviews.title: The worst
customer_reviews.text: This was without a doubt the worst cell phone I have ever owned. It was slow and had poor battery life. I would type in a letter then have to wait sometimes 5 - 10 seconds before entering the next letter. After less then 2 years the battery would no longer take a charge. It has convinced me never to purchase another Motorola phone.
customer_reviews.author: Tim Colmus

customer_reviews.title: Excellent smart phone
customer_reviews.text: I am very pleased with this smart phone. The only thing it needs is wireless charging but then the very fast Turbo charger makes up for that. It is more user friendly than the S7 that it replaces. The S7 delaminated after a couple of years (3 phones) and I have high hopes that Moto will not but that remains to be seen. The price is very easy on the hip.
customer_reviews.author: May I Offer You A Hand

customer_reviews.title: Don't worry about the preinstalled apps.
customer_reviews.text: This phone is just what I needed. Something modern but middle of the road, unlocked, and not stupid expensive. No complaints about the phone itself. The preinstalled Amazon apps aren't that bad. Nothing intrusive. Just disable the ones you don't use, it doesn't take up that much space. I think getting the phone a bit cheaper in exchange for a little less storage is totally worth it.
customer_reviews.author: BSD

customer_reviews.title: Trouble after 3 months
customer_reviews.text: The phone was great, but after 3 months started to freeze or shut down when not in use. I missed many important phone calls. i reset the phone several times, but it did not help at all. I liked Moto but can no longer trust it. I had to purchase a new phone, now i'm stuck trying to figure out what to do with it.
customer_reviews.author: Sixto

customer_reviews.title: Okay at first, total garbage in the long run
customer_reviews.text: I bought this phone on July 28, 2018. Needless to say, I've had it for a while now. This phone was decent at first but performance significantly downgraded after 4 months of regular use. It's gotten to the point where sometimes it takes about 4 - 6 seconds for the screen to even display after pressing the power button. Signal is complete garbage on this thing, too. I regularly clean storage space and delete various apps, just in hopes of speeding up performance, even if just by a little bit. But it never make a difference at all. Save your money and buy something that will last longer than 4 months and not drive you insane.
customer_reviews.author: aris

customer_reviews.title: Really is time to try another brand.
customer_reviews.text: I've gone through many Moto phones over the years. And after each one, I tell myself I should try something else. Bottom line with this one: I would have given it a 4-5 star review within maybe the first 9-months. But, for the last year-plus its just been sluggish. I don't attempt to do any rooting. I don't load it with a ton of extra apps. It just seems like the processor just gave up. Freezes constantly when simply scrolling and app or opening an app.
customer_reviews.author: S. E. GRISWOLD

customer_reviews.title: Phone battery dead on arrival.
customer_reviews.text: I am currently trying to reach the seller. But I purchased this phone with intentions of giving it to my daughter for a back to school gift and after turning phone on and setting it up. For her. I go to give it to her and battery is dead and will not take a charge. This is irritating as it a brand new phone and I has not gotten. A chance to use it and of course because I bought it early the return window is closed. Becareful when u buy things online because you could get a bad product and then can't return. Think I'll stick to buying from the retail stores. Or directly from manufacturer
customer_reviews.author: Felt

customer_reviews.title: NOT ALEXA HANDS FREE  !!!!!!!!
customer_reviews.text: Before you purchase this supposedly " hands free Alexa " G6 be forewarned that this is NOT hands free. The G7 is. With the G6 you need to double tap the Alexa app to ask a question. Good luck calling Amazon and Motorola to find out why they are advertising this as " hands free Alexa" when it is not
customer_reviews.author: Penelope Quirk

customer_reviews.title: Phone disconnects from carrier service randomly
customer_reviews.text: This is my 4th or 5th Moto G phone. This phone is great accept that it randomly loses service from the carrier for a minute or two at a time. It is very annoying. I know it's the phone and not the carrier service. I hope they update it and figure this problem out.
customer_reviews.author: STEVE

customer_reviews.title: What a piece of junk!
customer_reviews.text: This phone has caused Motorola to make my list and not the good list. I will never purchase another Moto anything as long as I live. within 2 weeks of owning it I had a cracked screen because It fell of my lap and yes it was in a protective case. Over all performance went down hill quick. It became very glitchy and would not react to basic functions. It drops phone calls and freezes up constantly. Spend a little more money and get something that'll last longer than a year. A complete waste of time and money.
customer_reviews.author: NellusMagnus

customer_reviews.title: Excellent phone, very fluid and feel very comfortable
customer_reviews.text: Excellent phone, very fluid and feel very comfortable. I will never buy a phone more expensive than this one anymore. Thanks Moto
customer_reviews.author: Bobson

customer_reviews.title: One of the best phones I've bought.
customer_reviews.text: It's fast and I like the turbo charging. I was tired of contracts, and phones DYING soon as My contract was up or the phone paid off, then the typical insurance wants 90.00 to give you a crappy refurbished that ends up dying less than a month later. I was Done with LG, Verizon, AT&T, TMobile. So far this phone has been reliable and best for the money.
customer_reviews.author: KOS

customer_reviews.title: glitches get stitches
customer_reviews.text: excellent phone! I have had no problems with it at all. its a good size and width. its a little longer and skinnier than my last phone but I like that it can reach my fingers across it better that way. I had serious glitch problems with a previous phone of mine so it's nice that there have had none thus far.

customer_reviews.title: Nice phone ruined by Amazon
customer_reviews.text: Spend the extra buy the normal version, if you want the amazon apps download them through the google play store but the 'prime' version of this phone is a bloated mess of annoying behaviors, bugs and spam.
customer_reviews.author: Jorge C.

customer_reviews.title: Good phone
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for my wife. She loves it! All she asked for was a decent camera and phone all in one. This was her first smart phone. It was a decent price and was what she wanted.
customer_reviews.author: Shaun

customer_reviews.title: WIFI drops all the time and no internet connectivity
customer_reviews.text: Forums are full of this problem with Moto and there is apparently no consistent or simple fix. Problem occurs on multiple networks so it is not a home router issue. I never had a minute of this ihappen with my old MOTO G4Play. Disgusted that I cannot return to Amazon as I've had it for 47 days. I will deal with Motorola ASAP and I hope it isn't a big hassle.
customer_reviews.author: Dane quilter

customer_reviews.title: This phone is junk!
customer_reviews.text: I don't know if I just got a lemon or not but it has had really bad reception from day one. I also have a Moto G5 plus and sitting side by side the G6 gets half as many bars! and the G5+ has a nicer screen. This was a Prime buy phone and as far as I'm concerned I Just wasted my money!
customer_reviews.author: Dusty2

customer_reviews.title: Great phone for a great price!
customer_reviews.text: I had my old phone for almost 4yrs because I generally don't update unless the phone has a problem. I wanted a phone with more memory, and my moto has that but it has many other features I'd been missing out on. I haven't tried the fingerprint or face recognition yet, but so far I'm really happy with my moto.
customer_reviews.author: Precept 1

customer_reviews.title: BATTERY SUCKS
customer_reviews.text: Bought this phone in a pinch.the phone itself seems ok.. battery SUCKS. I disabled and uninstalled every app I didn't need or want had it at full 100% charge before bed I wake up and it's at 60% with out it being used ..so definitely not a long lasting battery
customer_reviews.author: thornyyrose

customer_reviews.title: Good bang for you buck
customer_reviews.text: It's a nice phone with a large display, alright camera and good processing power. You are getting a great phone for the price you are paying. Only problem is that headphone jack doesn't seem to be working with my phone but I have Bluetooth headphones also so it's no problem.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Amazing for the price, tons of bugs
customer_reviews.text: Everything about this phone is great, aside from the few bugs that make the experience of making phone calls and absolute nightmare. The two biggest issues: 1. The phone cuts out call service far too often 2. The touch-tone numbers while on a call rarely work correctly, if at all Other than those major issues, the phone is solid. Not the fastest or prettiest phone in the world, but gets the job done.
customer_reviews.author: Brian Lichterman

customer_reviews.title: Update slowed my phone down
customer_reviews.text: An update a few months ago slowed my phone down considerably. The Moto forums said future updates would address the issue, but those updates didn't do a thing for me. Unfortunately for me, I am past the 12 month warranty period, so I can't turn to them for help. Fortunately for me, I destroyed the phone in a drunk rage. Why is this fortunate? I bought myself a OnePlus 7T with 0% financing for 12 months. Very excited for it. Do yourself a favor if you're looking for a cheap phone and don't buy this one. There are better, more reliable options out there.
customer_reviews.author: Bromar

customer_reviews.title: DO NOT BUY. WASTE OF TIME AND MONEY
customer_reviews.text: Do not buy. As soon as you do the oreo update the phone becomes useless. Problems with Wi-Fi. Data. Software in general. If you call motorola they will blame your carrier. Ask you to delete everything from your phone. Eventually ask you to pay to semd your phone in. Just to send you the same or another g6 that will have the same issues all over again. DO NOT BUY THE G6. Save your money and your time. You will end up in a pointless loop. And motorola will not help at all. They don't offer you another phone either even though the issues are brought on by their software update. I repeat. Do not buy
